content: wee balaclava based on ellen m silva s adult version updated 11/2014 my two year old son loves to play outside but never wanted to wear a hat and muffler unless threatened with the end of playtime so i decided to knit him a balaclava i had a hard time finding a toddler sized balaclava online much less in books and magazines the only ones i managed to find lacked the useful face guard that can be so-conveniently tucked under the chin i had made an adult sized one using ellen m silva s pattern and loved it so i buckled down did the math and came up with the toddler version materials approximately 150 yards worsted yarn shown in ella rae amity 75% acrylic 25% wool 200yds 100g note although wool would make the most sense warmth wise i know my son hates overheating and already operates at higher temperatures under normal circumstances use whatever fiber you want to deal with 12 size 6 us circular needles or a very long one if using the magic loop method spare circular of same or smaller size or a stitch holder size 6 dpns optional size 8 needle for binding off optional stitch markers waste yarn for provisional cast on tapestry needle gauge 5 st = 1 in stockinette notes k2tog knit 2 st together p2tog purl 2 st together pm place marker sm slip marker ssk slip 2 st kwise one at a time insert left needle into fronts of slipped st and k decrease ssptbl slip2 st kwise one at a time return both to left needle p2tog through back loops pattern co 76 place marker pm and join be careful not to twist your stitches start 2x2 rib until you have reached 8 in length or desired length ideally from nose to collarbone remove marker turn work and p32 place remaining stitches on the spare circular or stitch holder turn work and k32 continue stockinette for a total of 6 row with a scrap length of waste yarn do a provisional co of 40 st onto the right needle pm and continue stockinette in the round for 3 or appropriate length for crown begin decreases 6 decreases per decrease round *k10 k2tog* repeat * until end of round k entire round *k9 k2tog* repeat * until end of round k entire round keep repeating this pattern until you get to the following *k2 k2tog* repeat * until end of round *k1 k2tog* repeat * until end of round *k2tog* repeat * until end of round break off yarn and thread through remaining st cinch tight and weave in face ribbing remove the provisional cast-on and place st 40 st if you re one short just pick up a st from the corner onto either a 12 circular or dpns if you re facing the front of the balaclava starting at the upper left
